block.p: Paxton Louise Barnes, a daughter of Patricia Matthews of Manhattan and Howard Barnes of San Diego, is to be married today to Andrew Jay Schiff, a son of Ellen Schiff of Los Angeles and Irwin Schiff of Las Vegas. Rabbi Eric Polokoff is to officiate at the Washington, Conn., home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Edwin Matthews Jr.

Ms. Barnes, 32, will keep her name. She is an exhibit developer at the Bronx Zoo. She received a bachelor's degree in art history and anthropology from Boston University and a master's degree in education from Tufts University. Her mother is a retired news and documentary producer and is working on a book about Don Paradis, a former death row inmate in Idaho. The bride's father, who is retired, was the executive vice president of Group W Films, a subsidiary of Westinghouse Broadcasting in New York, and an executive producer of the 1970 feature film adaptation of Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's ''One Day in the Life of Ivan Denisovich.'' Her stepfather is a partner in Coudert Brothers, the law firm in Manhattan.
